3. API¶

Note

A “Spell”, in The Wizard Of Troz vernacular is a module that extends the core functionality of Troz. Other projects might call them plug-ins, extensions, or add-ons.

3.1. Base Class for Spells¶

class lib.spell.BaseSpell(self)¶

Bases: object

As the name implies, this class provides a base functionality for spells.

blacklist = '$a'¶

A string which, like pattern, will be compiled into a regular expression with the RE.VERBOSE flag. This will prevent any queries from being matched to the spell, even if they match the defined pattern. Defaults to $a which will never match anything.

config = {}¶

A dict that defines the configuration values that are required for this spell. The dictionary must be of the following format:

{
    'key1': type1,
    'key2': type2,
    ...
    'keyN': typeN
}

When starting up, Troz will check to make sure that those keys are defined in the config and will convert the values to the appropriate types.

To define an enumeration of possible values, define a list where where the first element is the type, followed by the possible values

For example:

{
    'security.mode': [str, 'high', 'medium', 'low', 'none']
}

Dotted notation is used to specify sections and subvalues. Nested values are not supported

fetch(url, post=None, get=None, format='raw')¶

Retrieve and return a web resource

Parameters:
  • url (str) – The URL of the resource to retrieve
  • post (dict) – If provided the retrieval will be done via a POST command, using the values provided here as the payload
  • get (dict) – If provided the retrieval will be done via a GET command, using the values provided here to build the query string
  • format (str) – Once the resource has been retrieved it will be decoded according to the value provided.
Valid values for format are:
  • raw – return the result without any post-processing. Returns a str
  • json – decode the result as a JSON; returns a dict
  • xml – decode the result as XML. Returns an ElementTree object
Returns:The result retrieved from the resource decoded with the post-processor specified in format
Return type:mixed
Raises :ValueError, HTTPError
incantation(query, config, state)¶
Parameters:
  • query (str) – The user’s query that was processed by lib.spell.BaseSpell.parse
  • config (dict) – The user configuration that is stored in settings.conf
  • state (dict) – A storage object that can be used to persist data between executions
Returns:

result, state
Return type:

str, dict
parse(query)¶
Parses a query and returns the result consisting of three values:

  • score: By default, this is equal to self.weight

  • spell: The current spell object (self)

  • match: The portion of the string that matched.

    If there is a regular expression group defined in self.pattern, then the first matching group is returned

Parameters:query (str) – The query to parse
Returns:a tuple of (score, spell, query)
Return type:tuple(float, self, str)
pattern = '$a'¶

A string which will be compiled into a regular expression with the RE.VERBOSE flag. Queries matching pattern and not excluded by the blacklist will be sent to this spell for processing, in order of their weight. Defaults to $a which will never match anything.

static today()¶
Returns:date a object preset to today
Return type:datetime.date
weight = -inf¶

How much weight / relevance should be assigned. Spells with larger weights are preferred over ones with smaller weights. Defaults to -inf

3.3.3. Shaman Test Helper¶

class lib.test.Shaman(self)¶

Bases: unittest2.case.TestCase

The Shaman will help illuminate flaws in your code and help you to heal them.

assertLooksLike(first, second, msg=None)¶

Compare first and second, ignoring differences in whitespace and case

Parameters:
  • first (str) – The first value to use in the comparison
  • second (str) – The second value to use in the comparison
  • msg (str or None) – Use a custom error message if the values don’t look alike
Raises :

AssertionError
classmethod collectQueries()¶

Run the test (silently) and return the queries issued, along with the associated results

Return type:dict
Returns:A dictionary mapping input queries to expected output
classmethod generate(*args, **kwargs)¶

A utility method that uses the arguments to duplicate the decorated test function

Parameters:
  • args (list) – The positional arguments
  • kwargs (dict) – The keyword arguments

The generated functions are named by taking the name of decorated function and then:

  • using numerically incrementing ids for input elements in *args
  • using the keyword provided for the input elements in **kwargs

For example:

@Shaman.generate('happy', 'sad', sleepy='Zzzz')
def test_example(input):
    pass

Would generate the following:

def test_example_1(input='happy'):
    pass

def test_example_2(input='sad'):
    pass

def test_example_sleepy(input='Zzzz'):
    pass

Warning

The decorated/original function gets destroyed when the generated functions get created

query(query)¶

Pass query to spell with mocked functions enabled, returning the result

Parameters:query (str) – The query to give to the spell
Returns:returns the result of the spell
Return type:str
classmethod setUpClass()¶

A class-level fixture that gets called automatically by unittest2; there should be no need to call this function directly.

This fixture takes care of the following:

  • The module being tested is automatically detected

  • The following mocks are configured:

    • state – creates a temporary storage for the spell’s state

    • config – a mock config that can be configured in the test and

      “loaded” by the config

    • web – overwrites lib.spell.BaseSpell.fetch with

      a lib.test.WebMock function which intercepts requests which are then served by predefined datafiles so that the test can be run offline

spell = None¶

The spell that is being tested

Note

You usually never have to set this value, it should get detected automatically. However, if you do set this value Shaman won’t overwrite it

spell_obj = None¶

An instantiated version of spell.

today(year, month, day)¶

Replace lib.spell.BaseSpell.today with a mock function which returns a constant date

Parameters:
  • year (int) – ex: 2010
  • month (int) – valid values are 1 (January) to 12 (December)
  • day (int) – valid values are 1 - 31, depending on the month
class lib.test.WebMock(self, root)¶
Parameters:root (str) – The root directory that contains the data files that will be used in the mock
mock_fetch(url, post=None, get=None, format='raw')¶

This function replaces lib.spell.BaseSpell.fetch when the mock is active.

:raises:Exception: Any request that does not match one predefined with route()
will result in an Exception being thrown.
route(url, file, post=None, get=None, format='raw')¶
Parameters:
  • url (str) – The base URL to intercept. Do not include the query string
  • file (str) – The file name (in self.root) that contains the response data corresponding to the request
  • post (dict or None) – If set, will only intercept URLs which have post data matching post
  • post – If set, will only intercept URLs which have get data matching post
  • format (str) – Only requests asking for the same format will be handled

3.3.1. Registry¶

lib.registry.all()¶

Return all registered spells

Return type:list
Returns:A list of dicts (see lookup_by_name for a description of the structure)
lib.registry.collect(root='spells')¶

Recursively find and import all modules under root

Parameters:root (str) – The directory to start the module searching at
lib.registry.enabled()¶

Return all registered spells in which the ‘enabled’ value is true.

Return type:list
Returns:A list of dicts (see lookup_by_name for a description of the structure)
lib.registry.get_root(cls)¶

Get the parent directory of the module that contains class cls

Parameters:cls (class) – The class in question
Return type:str
Returns:The parent directory path
lib.registry.lookup_by_name(**kwargs)¶

Return the first group to match the given arguments

Parameters:
  • spell (str) – If specified, search by spell
  • test (str) – If specified, search by test
Return type:

dict
Returns:

The group matchinging the given arguments
The result will be a dictionary with the following keys:

  • spell: A class deriving from lib.spell.BaseSpell

  • ‘test’: A class driving from lib.test.Shaman

  • ‘enabled`: If false, a required configuration is missing.

    Spells are disabled by lib.config.validate

lib.registry.register(**kwargs)¶

Register a new spell or test. Classes are automatically grouped together by directory (as determined by get_root

Parameters:
  • spell (str) – If specified, register a new spell
  • test (str) – If specified, register a new test

3.3.3. Testing Helpers¶

class lib.test.WebCapture¶

This is a proxy class that intercepts web requests and then prints information to the screen and also saves the result to a temporary file.

This is used to quickly build up test cases in a pseudo record/playback manner.

mock_get(url, **kwargs)¶

This replaces requests.get. It prints out the kwargs that is used to build the query string, passes the request along to the original get(...) function and then saves the result to a file

Parameters:
  • url (str) – The URL of the resource being requested
  • kwargs (dict) – The keyword arguments used to build the query string
Return type:

str
Returns:

The result from the original get(...) function
mock_post(url, data, **kwargs)¶

This replaces requests.post. It prints out post payload (data), passes the request along to the original get(...) function and then saves the result to a file

Parameters:
  • url (str) – The URL of the resource being requested
  • data (dict) – The data payload that will be sent via post to the server.
Return type:

str
Returns:

The result from the original get(...) function
